channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2190] Live from Apple's iPhone 4 press conference - Engadget
item.description: Apple's been pretty vague about what's going down today at the press conference it's holding in Cupertino, but we're going to be there live, covering whatever it is they have in store for us. So strap yourself into your seat, grab an orange soda, and keep it parked right at Engadget for the best, up-to-the-minute live coverage on the internet.

item.title: [+1494] Alyssa Milano To Old Spice Man: Are You Strong Enough? [vid]
item.description: Alyssa Milano replies with a video of her own and asks for a $100,000 donation to take the relationship to the next level. Classic!

item.title: [+1428] WTF. WTF. WTF. WTF. WTF. WTF. [Video]
[+1413] Click Here Fail [Pic]
[+1249] The Best Video Game Map Ever [PIC]
[+999] xkcd - temper
[+760] Sex with imaginary friends is still masturbation...
item.description: if i lived in the world of Foster's -- well first i'd try asking Frankie out. if that didn't work, well then maybe i'd put my imagination to good use.

item.title: [+724] Glenn Beck sides with Nazis, claims Jews killed Jesus
item.description: That's just the tip of a bizarre rant recently aired by News Corporation, which featured the chalkboard-handy host once again assailing Christian social justice efforts. -=W/ VIDEO=-

item.title: [+684] God Hates Nerds! Fred Phelps & Company to Protest Comic-Con
item.description: Apparently since they have nothing better to do, members of the Topeka, Kansas-based Westboro Baptist Church, which is led by Fred Phelps, plan to picket Comic-Con in San Diego.

item.title: [+639] 10 Things We Love About Weird Al's UHF
item.description: UHF is frickin' hilarious. Here are ten amazing things about the film.

item.title: [+637] 'Arrested Development' Movie Is Definitely Happening
item.description: At last, America, our long national nightmare is finally over. No, we're not talking about that little BP oil spill; that's yesterday's news. No, we're talking about something much bigger: the 'Arrested Development' movie is finally happening.

item.title: [+631] Free Bumpers: Apple's iPhone 4 Antenna Problem Solution
item.description: After arguing that all smartphones do the same as the iPhone 4, Apple has at last gave the solution we asked for: Free bumpers.

item.title: [+623] Boy tries to kill fish. Fish try to kill boy.
[+574] Man Fined $2,000 For Taking Garbage From Sidewalk
item.description: A guy in New York saw an air conditioner sitting on the sidewalk. A lady told him it was garbage. He took it -- and was fined $2,000. The car he was driving, which belongs to his aunt, was impounded -- and his aunt was also fined $2,000.

item.title: [+562] Cerebral Sci-Fi Films That Wipe Our Minds
item.description: Cerebral sci-fi is always hard to find, but Wired’s staff banged its brains and salvaged the following classics from speculative cinema’s past. Feed your head, then fire off your favorite mind-wipers in the comments section below.

item.title: [+544] Motorola Is Willing To Break the Phone They Just Sold You
item.description: We don't really like the Droid X as a phone, but that part barely matters now. You probably shouldn't buy the phone because doing so supports something very wrong—something anti-customer and anti-innovation—that Motorola is doing.

item.title: [+516] The Unpaid Intern, Legal or Not?
item.description: The number of unpaid internships has climbed in recent years, leading officials to worry that employers are illegally using interns for free labor.

item.title: [+508] 9 states support Arizona's immigration law
item.description: States have the authority to enforce immigration laws and protect their borders, Michigan Attorney General Mike Cox said Wednesday in a legal brief on behalf of nine states supporting Arizona's immigration law. Arizona is joined by Alabama, Florida, Nebraska, Pennsylvania, South Carolina, South Dakota, Texas and Virginia.

item.title: [+505] Robocop Ran DOS... and other movie code decoded
item.description: Virtually no sci-fi or action flick these days is complete without a computer scene showing a few screens of mysterious scrolling text and a 3D wire-frame model. But where does this vaguely tech-looking stuff come from? Well, more often than not, it comes from a Website, app, or startup screen from the real world at the time the movie was made

item.title: [+481] Burger Patty Made Entirely of Ground Bacon
item.description: It’s important to pace yourself when on a geek quest of any sort, and this is especially true of those that, like mine, present a certain amount of personal risk.
